title: Katherine Jenkins is joined by husband Andrew Levitas at Ronnie Scott's 60th Anniversary Gala
text:
She is known for her elegant sense of style as well as her impressive singing abilities.

And Katherine Jenkins looked nothing short of sensational as she stepped out for A Night At Ronnie Scott's: 60th Anniversary Gala at the Royal Albert Hall on Wednesday.

The opera singer, 39, cut an elegant figure at the event where she was joined by her husband Andrew Levitas.

Style: Katherine Jenkins, 39, looked nothing short of sensational as she stepped out for A Night At Ronnie Scotts: 60th Anniversary Gala at the Royal Albert Hall on Wednesday

Katherine donned a black crushes velvet minidress which featured a black sheer embellishment at the sleeves and hemline with a gold trim.

The songstress added height to her frame with a pair of black heels while she also carried a matching clutch bag.

Letting her blonde locks fall loose down her shoulders, Katherine completed her look for the evening with a pair of pearl earrings.

Andrew, 42, looked dapper in a navy check blazer with a matching waistcoat and trousers which he paired with a white shirt and dark tie.

Couple: The opera singer cut an elegant figure at the event where she was joined by her husband Andrew Levitas, 42

Also in attendance at the event was Helen McCrory who looked radiant in a flowing black dress.

The actress, 51, turned up the glamour with her garment which featured a v-neckline, puffed sleeves and a daring leg slit.

Helen, who also sported black heels, appeared to have suffered an injury as her left hand was wrapped in a white bandage.

Fashion: Katherine donned a black crushes velvet minidress which featured a black sheer embellishment at the sleeves and hemline with a gold trim

Outfit: The songstress added height to her frame with a pair of black heels while she also carried a matching clutch bag

Katherine's appearance comes after she recently discussed juggling motherhood with her work duties and detailed her strong connection to her late father.

She revealed she returned to work just weeks after giving birth to her son Xander, one, to avoid 'letting people down' as she featured on Giovanna Fletcher’s Happy Mum Happy Baby podcast.

The mezzo-soprano singer also touched on her childhood and shared that she speaks to her late father Selwyn, who passed away from lung cancer when she was just 15 in 1995, in her 'vivid dreams'.

Glamour: Also in attendance at the event was Helen McCrory, 51, who looked radiant in a flowing black dress

In June last year, the doting mother returned to work to perform Never Enough from The Greatest Showman at Classic Brit Awards at London's Royal Albert Hall, just a month after giving birth to her second child.

On bouncing back to work, the songstress, who also shares daughter Aaliyah, three, with husband of four years Andrew, explained: 'I did a smaller small when he was five weeks and a bigger one when he was seven weeks.

'The thing is its so hard, in classical music we book so far in advance so we actually book things 18 months ahead.

'Obviously you cant plan when you are going to get pregnant so I had to cancel quite a lot of international stuff in the time that I was not able to fly when I had him.

'After that point you sort of feel, now if I cancel these I could technically do them is there a way I can do them and get back into the bubble as quick as I can, I don’t like letting people down.'
